--- title: "Serious stuff" --- My name is **Mariia Atamaniuk**. I am a professional analyst with 5+ years of experience in market research, product and customer analytics, as well as in investment projects. I am also a student of MA program on **Business and Financial Economics** at the **Kyiv School of Economics**. ### Skills Experienced in SQL (PostgreSQL), R (RStudio), and Tableau. Skilled in data processing, dealing with databases, building models using econometric and statistics tools, setting and monitoring KPIs for products, facilitating digital marketing using Google Analytics and SEO tools. Advanced in spoken and written English. Good at communication with customers and managing various stakeholders, presenting insights to them. ![](MA_ava.jpg){fig-align="center" width="456"} I was born and live in **Kyiv** (Ukraine) - the capital of great people! Unfortunately, we have a noisy southern neighbor so we are sorry for the inconveniences if you decide to visit Ukraine now. ::: {.cell .column-screen-inset-shaded} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ### Plots As a data analyst, I am building nice graphs. It is my job to do so. By the way, these are not my graphs. ::: {.cell .column-screen-inset-shaded layout-nrow="1"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-3.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### SQL SQL is a bread and butter of the data analyst. Please find below some examples of my previous code. For example, how I calculated conversion chart for monthly registration cohorts. `SELECT DATE_PART('year', registration_date) AS year,` `DATE_PART ('month', registration_date) AS month,` `COUNT(*) AS registered_count,` `COUNT(CASE WHEN first_order_date IS null` `THEN customer_id END) AS no_sale,` `COUNT(CASE WHEN first_order_date - registration_date < INTERVAL '3' day` `THEN customer_id END) AS three_days,` `COUNT(CASE WHEN first_order_date - registration_date >= INTERVAL '3' day` `AND first_order_date - registration_date < INTERVAL '7' day` `THEN customer_id END) AS first_week,` `COUNT(CASE WHEN first_order_date - registration_date >= INTERVAL '7' day` `THEN customer_id END) AS after_first_week` `FROM customers` `GROUP BY DATE_PART('year', registration_date),` `DATE_PART ('month', registration_date)` `ORDER BY year, month;` ### Time series forecasting *I will add a document with the report on this upon finishing statistics course next month.* ### Machine learning project *Will be added in two weeks.* ### Ordered logit regression model *Adding in progress* ### Certificates I have a bunch of professional certificates that can prove you my expertise in the respective fields. ::: {layout-ncol="2"} ![SQL Bootcamp](SQL.jpg) ![Financial Markets by Yale University![]()](FinMarkets.jpg) ![Business Analysis and Process Management](BusAnal.jpg) ![Girls in Corporate Finance School by EY](Corp.jpg) ::: ### Contacts Let's stay in touch! Please fill in the form below if you have any immediate questions. *I know that this is so old-fashioned, but I wanted to practice inserting forms into this website. If you need to contact me, you can always reach me [on telegram](https://t.me/mashaataa).*
